title: 2 Kings Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of 2 Kings with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 25 chapters.

questions.question: Who was the king of Israel that fell through a lattice and sent messengers to inquire of Baalzebub, the god of Ekron?
questions.explanation: Ahaziah fell through a lattice and sent messengers to inquire of Baalzebub, as recorded in 2 Kings 1:2.

questions.question: What was Elijah's response when the captain of fifty was sent to bring him down from the hill?
options: He called fire down from heaven to consume them
questions.correctAnswer: He called fire down from heaven to consume them
questions.explanation: Elijah called fire down from heaven to consume the captain of fifty and his men who were sent to bring him down (2 Kings 1:10).

questions.question: How did the third captain of fifty sent to Elijah respond?
options: He also was consumed by fire
He begged for his life and his men’s lives
questions.correctAnswer: He begged for his life and his men’s lives
questions.explanation: The third captain of fifty fell on his knees and begged Elijah to spare his life and those of his men (2 Kings 1:13).

questions.question: What was the Lord's message to Ahaziah through Elijah?
options: He would recover from his sickness
He would not come down from his bed but surely die
He would be victorious over his enemies
He would reign for many years
questions.correctAnswer: He would not come down from his bed but surely die
questions.explanation: Elijah told Ahaziah that because he sought Baalzebub, he would not recover but die (2 Kings 1:4).

questions.question: What rebellion took place after Ahab's death?
questions.explanation: Moab rebelled against Israel after the death of Ahab (2 Kings 1:1).

questions.question: In 2 Kings 3, who was the king of Moab that rebelled against Israel?
questions.explanation: Mesha was the king of Moab who rebelled against Israel as told in 2 Kings 3:4.

questions.question: What miracle did Elisha perform to help the allied kings find water in the wilderness?
options: He caused water to flow in the valley
questions.correctAnswer: He caused water to flow in the valley
questions.explanation: Elisha prophesied that the valley would be filled with water without wind or rain (2 Kings 3:16-17).

questions.question: In 2 Kings 4, what was the miracle Elisha performed for the widow of a prophet?
options: He raised her son from the dead
He gave her a new house
questions.explanation: Elisha multiplied the widow's oil so she could pay her debts and live (2 Kings 4:1-7).

questions.question: Which king of Israel was healed of leprosy after washing seven times in the Jordan, as instructed by Elisha?
questions.explanation: Naaman, the Syrian commander, was healed of leprosy after washing seven times in the Jordan River (2 Kings 5:10-14).

questions.question: What was the reaction of Gehazi, Elisha's servant, after Naaman was healed?
options: He deceitfully took gifts and was struck with leprosy
He went to the king to tell him
questions.correctAnswer: He deceitfully took gifts and was struck with leprosy
questions.explanation: Gehazi lied and took gifts from Naaman and was cursed with his leprosy (2 Kings 5:20-27).

questions.question: In 2 Kings 6, how did Elisha protect the city of Dothan from the Syrian army?
options: He prayed for a strong wind to blow them away
He blinded the Syrians with the eyes of the Lord
He made an army appear to fight for Israel
questions.correctAnswer: He blinded the Syrians with the eyes of the Lord
questions.explanation: Elisha prayed and the Lord struck the Syrians with blindness (2 Kings 6:18).

questions.question: What was the name of the king of Israel during Elisha's miracles in chapters 3 to 6?
questions.explanation: Jehoram was king of Israel during many of Elisha's miracles (2 Kings 3:1).

questions.question: In 2 Kings 7, what caused the Syrian army to flee from Samaria, leaving behind their tents and supplies?
options: A great noise of chariots and horses
questions.correctAnswer: A great noise of chariots and horses
questions.explanation: The Lord caused the Syrians to hear a noise of a great army, causing them to flee (2 Kings 7:6-7).

questions.question: What did the four leprous men at the gate decide to do in 2 Kings 7?
options: Remain and die at the city gate
Go into the Syrian camp to seek help
questions.correctAnswer: Go into the Syrian camp to seek help
questions.explanation: They decided to risk entering the deserted Syrian camp to find food and survive (2 Kings 7:3-4).

questions.question: What happened to the lord on whose hand the king leaned after the famine ended in Samaria?
options: He was trampled to death by the people
questions.correctAnswer: He was trampled to death by the people
questions.explanation: He was trampled to death at the gate as the people rushed out to gather food (2 Kings 7:17).

questions.question: In 2 Kings 8, which widow did Elisha help by prophesying that she would regain her land?
questions.explanation: Elisha told the Shunammite woman she would regain her land after the famine (2 Kings 8:1-6).

questions.question: Who succeeded Ahab as king of Israel, as mentioned in 2 Kings 9?
questions.explanation: Jehoram, son of Ahab, became king after Ahab (2 Kings 9:29).

questions.question: Who was the king of Judah during the reign of Jehoram king of Israel?
questions.explanation: Jehoram of Israel reigned during the second year of Jehoram son of Jehoshaphat king of Judah (2 Kings 1:17).

questions.question: In 2 Kings 13, how many times did Joash smite the ground with arrows as instructed by Elisha?
questions.explanation: Joash smote the ground thrice with arrows, though Elisha rebuked him for not smiting five or six times (2 Kings 13:18-19).

questions.question: What happened when a man was buried and his body touched Elisha’s bones?
questions.explanation: The man revived when he was cast into Elisha’s tomb and touched his bones (2 Kings 13:21).

questions.question: Which king of Judah rent his clothes and prayed in the house of the Lord when he heard the threat of the Assyrians in 2 Kings 19?
questions.explanation: Hezekiah rent his clothes and prayed to the LORD in the temple when Assyria threatened Jerusalem (2 Kings 19:1-2).

questions.question: True or False: Jehu was commanded by God to destroy the house of Ahab and the worshipers of Baal.
questions.explanation: God commanded Jehu to destroy Ahab’s house and Baal worshippers as part of judgment (2 Kings 9:6-10).

questions.question: True or False: Elisha performed a miracle by making an iron axe head float on water.
questions.explanation: Elisha made the iron axe head float when it had fallen into the water (2 Kings 6:6).

questions.question: True or False: The land of Israel was delivered from the Syrians during Jehoahaz's reign because he completely turned from sin.
questions.explanation: Though God gave Israel a savior, Jehoahaz did not depart from the sins of Jeroboam (2 Kings 13:4-6).

questions.question: True or False: The Syrian army was struck with blindness by Elisha’s prayer, and he led them to Samaria.
questions.explanation: Elisha prayed for their blindness and led them to Samaria where they were captured (2 Kings 6:18-20).

questions.question: True or False: The prophet Elisha was taken up to heaven in a chariot of fire.
questions.explanation: It was Elijah who was taken up in a chariot of fire, not Elisha (2 Kings 2).

questions.question: True or False: Naaman was healed of his leprosy after obeying Elisha’s instruction to dip seven times in the Jordan River.
questions.explanation: Naaman was healed after dipping seven times in the Jordan as Elisha instructed (2 Kings 5:10-14).

questions.question: True or False: Jehoram of Judah was killed by Jehu king of Israel.
questions.explanation: Jehu killed Jehoram of Israel, not Judah (2 Kings 9:24).

questions.question: True or False: Elisha raised the Shunammite woman’s son from the dead.
questions.explanation: Elisha prayed and the child was revived (2 Kings 4:32-35).

questions.question: True or False: The Syrians believed Israel had hired the kings of the Hittites and Egyptians to attack them because of a loud noise made by the Lord.
questions.explanation: The Syrians fled thinking Israel had hired powerful allies because of the noise caused by the Lord (2 Kings 7:6-7).

questions.question: True or False: The famine in Samaria was prolonged because the king did not believe Elisha's prophecy.
questions.explanation: The famine ended as Elisha prophesied, but the lord on whom the king leaned died (2 Kings 7).

questions.question: True or False: The bones of Elisha had the power to revive a dead man when his body touched them.
questions.explanation: A dead man revived when cast into Elisha’s tomb and touching his bones (2 Kings 13:21).

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'And Elisha said, Hear ye the word of the LORD; Thus saith the LORD, To morrow about this time shall a measure of fine flour be sold for a ______.'
questions.explanation: Elisha prophesied the price of flour would be a shekel (2 Kings 7:1).

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'And he said, Open the window eastward. And he opened it. Then Elisha said, Shoot. And he shot. And he said, The arrow of the LORD'S ______.'
questions.explanation: Elisha called the arrow the arrow of the LORD's deliverance (2 Kings 13:17).

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'And he said unto him, Thus saith the LORD, Forasmuch as thou hast sent messengers to enquire of Baalzebub, the god of Ekron, is it not because there is no God in ______?'
questions.explanation: God pointed out there was no god in Israel like Him (2 Kings 1:3).

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'And Jehoash the son of Jehoahaz took again out of the hand of Benhadad the son of Hazael the cities, which he had taken out of the hand of Jehoahaz his father by war. Three times did Joash beat him, and ______ the cities of Israel.'
questions.explanation: Joash recovered the cities taken by Benhadad (2 Kings 13:25).

questions.question: Who was the prophet that succeeded Elijah and performed many miracles recorded in 2 Kings?
questions.explanation: Elisha was Elijah’s successor and performed many miracles (2 Kings 2).

questions.question: Which king of Judah sought the Lord when Jerusalem was besieged by the Assyrians?
questions.explanation: Hezekiah prayed and sought the Lord during the Assyrian siege (2 Kings 19:1-2).

questions.question: What did Elisha do to the pot of stew that was poisoned, making it safe to eat?
options: He prayed for it to be purified
questions.explanation: Elisha threw flour into the pot and it was purified (2 Kings 4:38-41).

questions.question: During whose reign did the kingdom of Israel fall to Assyria?
questions.explanation: Hoshea was the last king of Israel before Assyria conquered Samaria (2 Kings 17).

questions.question: Which prophet warned King Hezekiah that God would defend Jerusalem from the Assyrian king Sennacherib?
questions.explanation: Isaiah told Hezekiah God would protect Jerusalem from Assyria (2 Kings 19:20-34).

questions.question: Who was the Moabite king who rebelled against Israel after Ahab's death?
questions.explanation: Mesha rebelled against Israel after Ahab died (2 Kings 3:4).

questions.question: What was the fate of King Zedekiah of Judah after Jerusalem was captured by the Babylonians?
options: His eyes were put out and he was taken captive
questions.correctAnswer: His eyes were put out and he was taken captive
questions.explanation: Zedekiah was blinded and taken to Babylon after Jerusalem’s fall (2 Kings 25:7).

questions.question: What happened to the temple of the LORD when the Babylonians came to Jerusalem?
questions.explanation: The Babylonians burned and destroyed the temple (2 Kings 25:9).

questions.question: Who was the Babylonian king who conquered Jerusalem and carried away many captives?
questions.explanation: Nebuchadnezzar conquered Jerusalem and took captives (2 Kings 24-25).
